item.description:
Special August Moon Festival @ Chinatown

12pm @ 12 August 2012 (Sunday afternoon)

Boston's Chinatown comes alive with lion dances, martial arts, firecrackers, folk dances, and lots of vendors for the annual Chinese Moon Festival, also called the Mid-Autumn Festival.

 

What does the festival actually celebrate?

Possibilities include the legend of Chang'e, the immortal Lady of the Moon, and the overthrow of the Mongol rulers in 1368 when a rebel leader distributed mooncakes (which Mongols didn't eat) with messages hidden inside saying "Kill the Mongols."

Although this 3,000+ year old Chinese festival traditionally falls on the 12th day of the 8th Lunar month - in other words, late September/early October - Boston celebrates it in mid-August.  It's the perfect excuse to spend an August Sunday in Chinatown. Start with dim sum, and then enjoy the colorful festival.

WHEN: 12pm - 12 August 2012 (Sunday)

WHERE: Harrison & Beach Street, Chinatown, Boston, MA

TRANSPORT: Orange Line

August Moon Festival - Harrison & Beach Streets, Boston's Chinatown

Boston Chinatown August Moon Festival
Location: Chinatown - Harrison & Beach Street, Boston's Chinatown
Date: August 12,2012 
Time: 10am-5pm
Cost: FREE

See cute kids doing martial arts and dancing on two outdoor stages!

  • Vendor booths, Chinese Dough Art, Chinese Opera
  • Childrens Chinese folk dance
  • Martial Arts Performance, Lion Dances

http://www.boston.com/yourtown/boston/downtown/gallery/august_moon_festival/

The annual August Moon Festival is presented by the Chinese Consolidated Benevolent Association of New England, the Chinatown Business Association and Chinatown Main Street.

The traditional festival celebrates the harvest, but it also honors women, who are associated with the moon in Chinese cosmology, and mountain climbing, as the festival is said to have originated when the god of a sacred mountain invited other gods to a feast.

 

Boston Chinatown August Moon Festival

Location: Chinatown

Date: August 12,2012

Time: 10am-5pm

Cost: FREE

Vendor booths, Chinese Dough Art, Chinese Opera

Childrens Chinese folk dance

Martial Arts Performance, Lion Dances

 

REFERENCES:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mid-Autumn_Festival

http://bostoneventsinsider.com/bostonevents/2012/08-06/chinatown-august-moon-festival.htm

http://www.chiff.com/summer/boston-street-fairs.htm
item.how_to_find_us: This is a HOST-FREE Meetup. You are free to walk around on your own or with friends, but don't expect anyone from this meetup to rendezvous with you are a specific time and place.

group.name: The Boston Mandarin Chinese Language Meetup Group

item.name: August Moon Festival @ Boston's Chinatown, Harrison & Beach Streets
